9. ABSTRACT
This booklet describes the activities of the Consultative Group on International 
Agricultural Research (CGIAR) and the research and training it sponsors. 
The purpose of the Group is to bring the resources of modern biological and 
socio-economic research to bear on the possibilities of agricultural progress 
in the tropics and sub-tropics where nearly all the LDCs lie. The Croup seeks 
to give the LDCs superior varieties of essential crops and improved systems 
for the production of food, plants and animals. The opening chapter gives a 
general introduction to these subjects. The remaining chapters describe the 
work of each of the international institutes. These are: International Rice 
Research Institute, International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center, 
International Center for Tropical Agriculture, International Potato Center, 
International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics, International 
Laboratory for Research on Animal Diseases, International Livestock Center 
for Africa, West Africa Rice Development Association, International Board for 
Plant Genetic Resources, International Centre for Agricultural Research in the 
Dry Areas. This Booklet is intended for the use of policy makers, specialists, 
and interested laymen who may find ways to benefit from or assist the work of 
the research network.
